title: On one hand, Socrates says “whole knowledge within you,” and on the other hand, he says “I know nothing.” Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: Only a fool believes they know everything. A wise man truly believes he knows nothing. In order to ever gain knowledge you must first be humble enough to say to yourself “I know there are things that i do not know”. This beautiful concept is the beginning of all knowledge. A “know it all” trait is not a desired one.

Knowing he knows nothing is his entire teaching method, no? Socratically. He will draw you out with incisive questions showing you your blind spots and what you do also know, or not know. Only if you have an end to the path, do you know where you are going.
